pic2_alt: A map of some of the polling place data that shows polling place changes in East Baton Rouge, Louisiana. The highlighted polling place was moved from Twin Oaks Elementary 1.6 miles away to Sherwood Middle School. On average, voters affected by this change had to travel 1.1 more miles than they would have in 2014. This change affected 3169 voters, of whom 1229 identified as Black and 1643 identified as white. The old polling place was near an all-black neighborhood, while the new polling place is in a majority-white neighborhood.
